title: DHS Homeless Outreach Team
name: DHS Homeless Outreach Team
description:
A Map by Maraccini

Locations of Homeless Outreach Team members who can assist persons who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless acquire mainstream benefits and locate additional resources.

properties.name: DHS Eastside Food Stamp Office
properties.description: Posted by Maraccini 2855 Tremont Place, Denver, CODHS Program Case Manager available on a currently limited basis to assist individuals with aplpications for mainstream benefits.

properties.name: Denver Department of Human Services
properties.description: Posted by Maraccini1200 Federal Boulevard, Denver, CODenver Department of Human Services main office (Richard T. Castro Building) DHS General Assistance Unit and Homeless Outreach Team

properties.name: Empowerment Program
properties.description: Posted by Maraccini1600 York Street #201, Denver, COA Denver DHS Program Case Manager is available on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Fridays to assist women with their applications for mainstream benefits such as Food Stamps, Aid to the Needy and Disabled, and Old Age Pension. Other emergency services may be available.

properties.name: Salvation Army: Crossroads Shelter for Men
properties.description: Posted by Maraccini1901 29th Street, Denver, CODHS Program Case Managers are available Monday through Thursday to assist men with their applications for mainstream benefits such as Food Stamps and Aid to the Needy and Disabled. Other emergency services may be available.

properties.name: Samaritan House
properties.description: Posted by Maraccini2301 Lawrence Street, Denver, CODenver Department of Human Services has a Program Case Manager available four to five days each week to assist individuals and families in applying for and acquiring benefits such as Food Stamps, Aid to the Needy and Disabled, and Old Age Pension. Other services may be available for people who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless.

properties.name: Senior Support Services
properties.description: Posted by Maraccini846 E. 18th Avenue, Denver, CO Program Case Managers from Denver DHS are available on Wednesdays and Thursdays to assist individuals with their applications for mainstream benefits such as Aid to the Needy and Disabled, Food Stamps, and Old Age Pension. Other emergency services may be available.

properties.name: St. Francis Center
properties.description: Posted by Maraccini2323 Curtis Street, Denver, CoDHS Program Case Manager available Tuesday and Thursday mornings to assist individuals with their applications for mainstream benefits such as Aid to the Needy and Disabled, Old Age Pension, and Food Stamps. Other emergency services may be available.

properties.name: Stout Street Clinic
properties.description: Posted by Maraccini2100 Broadway, Denver, CODHS Program Case Managers are available Monday through Thrusday to assist families and individuals with their applications for mainstream benefits such as Aid to the Needy and Disabled, Food Stamps, and Old Age Pension. Other emergency services may be available.

properties.name: The Crossing (A Denver Rescue Mission Transitional Living Program)
properties.description: Posted by Maraccini6090 Smith Road, Denver, CoDHS Program Case Manager available Monday through Friday to assist individuals and families with their applications for mainstream benefits such as Food Stamps and Aid to the Needy and Disabled. Other emergency services may be available.

properties.name: The Gathering Place
properties.description: Posted by Maraccini1535 High Street, Denver, CODenver Department of Human Services has a Program Case Manager available several days each week to assist individuals and families in applying for and acquiring benefits such as Food Stamps, Aid to the Needy and Disabled, and Old Age Pension. Other services may be available for people who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless.

properties.name: VOA Family Motel
properties.description: Posted by Maraccini  4855 W Colafx Ave, Denver, COEmergency lodging for families with children, women, and homeless persons in need of medical respite. Other DHS services are available on-site for application.
